page.title: 02CLUBS IN BILSTHORPE
page.content: Bilsthorpe has quite a few halls for meetings. At the village hall, the Monday Club (Elderley folk of both sexes) enjoy games and tea. The Darby and Joan Club meet on a Wednesday, Womens Welfare once a week, Womens Institute once a month. There are 2 Jazz Bands, the Applejacks and the Legionaires who both meet once a week. Badminton and Whist Drives are also played regulary. The Scout Hut is used by the Cubs, Guides and Brownies. The St. Johns Ambulance Brigade which has its own hall have an Adult and Childrens Section which meet weekly. The Youth Club meets at the Community Hall, a Luncheon Club meets there every Thursday and also a Mother and Toddler. The Miners Welfare is a Licensed Social Club run by the Miners and has weekly entertainment.
